segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 8. Ānandavagga
segments.en: 8. Ānanda

segments.pli: 71. Channasutta
segments.en: 71. With Channa

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho channo paribbājako yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the wanderer Channa went up to Venerable Ānanda and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho channo paribbājako āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Ānanda:

segments.pli: “tumhepi, āvuso ānanda, rāgassa pahānaṃ paññāpetha, dosassa pahānaṃ paññāpetha, mohassa pahānaṃ paññāpethā”ti.
segments.en: “Reverend Ānanda, do you advocate giving up greed, hate, and delusion?”

segments.pli: “Mayaṃ kho, āvuso, rāgassa pahānaṃ paññāpema, dosassa pahānaṃ paññāpema, mohassa pahānaṃ paññapemā”ti.
segments.en: “We do, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, rāge ādīnavaṃ disvā rāgassa pahānaṃ paññāpetha, kiṃ dose ādīnavaṃ disvā dosassa pahānaṃ paññāpetha, kiṃ mohe ādīnavaṃ disvā mohassa pahānaṃ paññāpethā”ti?
segments.en: “But what drawbacks have you seen, Reverend Ānanda, that you advocate giving up greed, hate, and delusion?”

segments.pli: “Ratto kho, āvuso, rāgena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto attabyābādhāyapi ceteti, parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti, cetasikampi dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti;
segments.en: “A greedy person, overcome by greed, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.

segments.pli: rāge pahīne nevattabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
segments.en: When greed has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.

segments.pli: Ratto kho, āvuso, rāgena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, manasā duccaritaṃ carati;
segments.en: A greedy person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: rāge pahīne neva kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, na vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, na manasā duccaritaṃ carati.
segments.en: When greed has been given up, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Ratto kho, āvuso, rāgena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto attatthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, paratthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, ubhayatthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti;
segments.en: A greedy person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.

segments.pli: rāge pahīne attatthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, paratthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ubhayatthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: When greed has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.

segments.pli: Rāgo kho, āvuso, andhakaraṇo acakkhukaraṇo aññāṇakaraṇo paññānirodhiko vighātapakkhiko anibbānasaṃvattaniko.
segments.en: Greed is a destroyer of sight, vision, and knowledge. It blocks wisdom, it’s on the side of anguish, and it doesn’t lead to extinguishment.

segments.pli: Duṭṭho kho, āvuso, dosena … pe …
segments.en: A hateful person, overcome by hate, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. …

segments.pli: mūḷho kho, āvuso, mohena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto attabyābādhāyapi ceteti, parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti, cetasikampi dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti;
segments.en: A deluded person, overcome by delusion, intends to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They experience mental pain and sadness.

segments.pli: mohe pahīne nevattabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na parabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na ubhayabyābādhāyapi ceteti, na cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
segments.en: When delusion has been given up, they don’t intend to hurt themselves, hurt others, and hurt both. They don’t experience mental pain and sadness.

segments.pli: Mūḷho kho, āvuso, mohena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, manasā duccaritaṃ carati;
segments.en: A deluded person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: mohe pahīne neva kāyena duccaritaṃ carati, na vācāya duccaritaṃ carati, na manasā duccaritaṃ carati.
segments.en: When delusion has been given up, they don’t do bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.

segments.pli: Mūḷho kho, āvuso, mohena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto attatthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, paratthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, ubhayatthampi yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti;
segments.en: A deluded person doesn’t truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.

segments.pli: mohe pahīne attatthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, paratthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ubhayatthampi yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: When delusion has been given up, they truly understand what’s for their own good, the good of another, or the good of both.

segments.pli: Moho kho, āvuso, andhakaraṇo acakkhukaraṇo aññāṇakaraṇo paññānirodhiko vighātapakkhiko anibbānasaṃvattaniko.
segments.en: Delusion is a destroyer of sight, vision, and knowledge; it blocks wisdom, it’s on the side of anguish, and it doesn’t lead to extinguishment.

segments.pli: Idaṃ kho mayaṃ, āvuso, rāge ādīnavaṃ disvā rāgassa pahānaṃ paññāpema.
segments.en: This is the drawback we’ve seen in greed, hate, and delusion, and this is why we advocate giving them up.”

segments.pli: Idaṃ dose ādīnavaṃ disvā dosassa pahānaṃ paññāpema.
Idaṃ mohe ādīnavaṃ disvā mohassa pahānaṃ paññāpemā”ti.
“Atthi panāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?
segments.en: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion?”

segments.pli: “Atthāvuso, maggo atthi paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.
segments.en: “There is, reverend, a path and a practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”

segments.pli: “Katamo panāvuso, maggo katamā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti?
segments.en: “Well, what is it?”

segments.pli: “Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

segments.pli: sammādiṭṭhi … pe … sammāsamādhi.
segments.en: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, maggo ayaṃ paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāyā”ti.
segments.en: This is the path, this is the practice for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.”

segments.pli: “Bhaddako kho, āvuso, maggo bhaddikā paṭipadā etassa rāgassa dosassa mohassa pahānāya.
segments.en: “This is a fine path, a fine practice, for giving up that greed, hate, and delusion.

segments.pli: Alañca panāvuso ānanda, appamādāyā”ti.
segments.en: Just this much is enough to be diligent.”

segments.pli: Paṭhamaṃ.
